citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
Dogs used on protocol #02-22 underwent a terminal anesthesia procedure and increased volume blood draw that were
not defined in the IACUC approved protocol. The addition of the procedures were approved by the attending veterinarian
rather than the IACUC. The facility does not have an IACUC approved policy in place for the attending veterinarian to
approve changes to a protocol on behalf of the IACUC. The IACUC shall review and approve, require modifications to
secure approval or withhold approval of proposed significant changes regarding the care and use of animals in ongoing
activities. Correct by August 31, 2023.

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC)
citations.narrative:
Review of IACUC minutes disclosed that protocol #02-22 was reviewed and approved solely by email correspondence
from the IACUC. Appropriate IACUC review is necessary to safeguard the use of all animals on study. The IACUC shall
review proposed activities involving the care and use of animals and any member can call for a full Committee review. If
not, the chairman can designate a member to review and have the authority to approve, modify or request full Committee
review of any of those activities. No member may participate in IACUC review or approval of an activity in which that
member is personally involved in the activity.
Correct by August 31, 2023.

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
Protocol #02-22 did not contain a rationale for the number of animals to be used. The study stated they would use sixteen
dogs total, dividing into subsets. This approach would ‘balance achieving statistical significance while minimizing the
number of dogs used’. No details such as statistical tests used or statisticians consulted were included to support the
statement. An animal use proposal must include a rationale for the appropriateness of the numbers of animals to be used
so that the IACUC can conduct a thorough review of the components of the activities related to the care and use of
animals and determine that the proposed activities are in accordance with the Animal Welfare Act. The proposal to
conduct an activity involving animals must contain a rationale for the numbers of animals to be used.
Correct by August 31, 2023.

The facility did not record the disposition information for sixteen dogs. Failure to maintain completed animal records
hinders accurate tracking, identification, and tracing of animals upon their removal from the current facility. Every research
facility shall keep and maintain records for live dogs which fully and correctly disclose the required information for the
transporting, selling, or otherwise disposing of any live dog.
Correct by August 31, 2023.

The registrant did not develop and document a written exercise plan for sixteen dogs used on study #02-22. Exercise is
important for the well-being of the dogs. Research facilities must develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to
provide dogs with the opportunity for exercise. In addition, the plan must be approved by the attending veterinarian and
available during APHIS inspections for review.
Correct by August 31, 2023.

The facility does not have a documented program of veterinary care. The facility completed a study, housing and using
dogs in February 2023. The absence of a program of veterinary care disallows assurance that the preventive care and
treatment is aligned with the veterinarian's authority and guidance. A written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC) for dogs
must be established and maintained so that the facility has a current plan that provides for adequate preventative care
and treatments as deemed necessary. The plan must include all required components as listed in the Animal Welfare Act
and Animal Welfare Regulations, Part 3, Subpart A, Section 3.13.
Correct by August 31, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with authorized person.
Additional Inspectors:
SUSANNE BRUNKHORST, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
